Authors:
William J Davis, Kevin R Amses, E S James, Timothy Y.
James
Title:
A new 18S rRNA phylogeny of uncultured predacious fungi
(Zoopagales).
Keywords:
Acaulopage, Cochlonema, single-cell amplification,
Stylopage, Zoopage, Zoopagomycota, Zoophagus
Abstract:
Previous molecular phylogenetic studies have shown that
families in Zoopagales are not monophyletic. To test the monophyly of
genera and species in the order, we used a single-cell approach to
generate nuclear 18S rRNA (18S) sequences for 10 isolates representing
nine taxa. We provide the first sequences for the genus Zoopage and
additional sequences for taxa in Cocholonema, Acaulopage, and Zoophagus.
Our results reveal that Zoophagus, Zoopage, and Acaulopage tetraceros
are not monophyletic. We conclude that morphology alone is not
sufficient to delineate genera and species in the order and encourage
studies that increase genetic sampling of taxa including type
species.
